comments:
When running bottom-up scenario end-to-end, I'm getting the following error:

IWAB0024E Error in copying Webservice Utility file.
    java.io.IOException: Cannot find runtime/webserviceutils.jar
    at org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.FindSupport.openStream
(FindSupport.java:237)
    at org.eclipse.core.runtime.Plugin.openStream(Plugin.java:439)
    at 
org.eclipse.jst.ws.internal.consumption.ui.widgets.test.CopyWebServiceUtilsJarCo
mmand.copyIFile(CopyWebServiceUtilsJarCommand.java:116)
    at 
org.eclipse.jst.ws.internal.consumption.ui.widgets.test.CopyWebServiceUtilsJarCo
mmand.execute(CopyWebServiceUtilsJarCommand.java:68)
    at 
org.eclipse.jst.ws.internal.consumption.ui.widgets.test.wssample.WSSampleFinishC
ommand.execute(WSSampleFinishCommand.java:93)
    at 
org.eclipse.jst.ws.internal.consumption.ui.widgets.test.ClientTestDelegateComman
d.execute(ClientTestDelegateCommand.java:87)
    at 
org.eclipse.wst.command.env.core.fragment.CommandFragmentEngine.runCommand
(CommandFragmentEngine.java:322)
    at org.eclipse.wst.command.env.core.fragment.CommandFragmentEngine.visitTop
(CommandFragmentEngine.java:288)

The fix is to change CopyWebServiceUtilsJarCommand to change:

Status status = copyIFile("runtime/webserviceutils.jar",webModulePath,"WEB-
INF/lib/webserviceutils.jar", getPlugin("org.eclipse.jst.ws.consumption"),env);

TO:

Status status = copyIFile("webserviceutils.jar",webModulePath,"WEB-
INF/lib/webserviceutils.jar", getPlugin("org.eclipse.jst.ws.consumption"),env);

Since the build.properties had been changed to generate webserviceutils.jar in 
the root directory of the plugin, not in the runtime directory.

With self-hosting, the user had to generate build.xml and run the ANT script to 
create webservicesutils.jar, then refresh the org.eclipse.jst.ws.consumption 
plugin in order for the webserviceutils.jar to show up in the workspace and 
have the Web service wizard copy the JAR successfully.

Created an attachment (id=17668)
patch for ws.consumption.ui

This occured after I relocated jars to the root directories of their plugins as 
advised in "WTP Development Practices" [1], but didn't update 
CopyWebServiceUtilsJarCommand. Thanks for handling this, Kathy.

Patch committed.
Changed Version field given new release numbering.
